## Description {#details}

Analysis pass providing the <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo">TargetTransformInfo</a></code>.

The core idea of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetiranalysis">TargetIRAnalysis</a> is to expose an interface through which LLVM targets can analyze and provide information about the middle end&#39;s target-independent IR. This supports use cases such as target-aware cost modeling of IR constructs.

This is a function analysis because much of the cost modeling for targets is done in a subtarget specific way and LLVM supports compiling different functions targeting different subtargets in order to support runtime dispatch according to the observed subtarget.

Definition at line 3194 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h">TargetTransformInfo.h</a>.

## Public Constructors

### TargetIRAnalysis() {#abe59727f7716a4af041daffad2b92a74}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="TargetIRAnalysis::TargetIRAnalysis ()">
Default construct a target IR analysis.

This will use the module&#39;s datalayout to construct a baseline conservative <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> result.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h/#l03202">3202</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h">TargetTransformInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targettransforminfo-cpp/#l01446">1446</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targettransforminfo-cpp">TargetTransformInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### TargetIRAnalysis() {#ad9b3e031d427ff87242241e462fd0658}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>TargetIRAnalysis::TargetIRAnalysis (std::function&lt; <a href="#a86179e1ebe9886a51ca1212368ee1e24">Result</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;)&gt; TTICallback)</>}>
Construct an IR analysis pass around a target-provide callback.

The callback will be called with a particular function for which the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> is needed and must return a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> object for that function.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h/#l03208">3208</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h">TargetTransformInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targettransforminfo-cpp/#l01448">1448</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targettransforminfo-cpp">TargetTransformInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h/#l03227">3227</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h">TargetTransformInfo.h</a>.

### TTICallback {#acf2039ccbc871ef6dd4b61c826182940}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::function&lt;Result(const Function &amp;)&gt; llvm::TargetIRAnalysis::TTICallback</>}>
The callback used to produce a result.

We use a completely opaque callback so that targets can provide whatever mechanism they desire for constructing the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> for a given function.

FIXME: Should we really use std::function? It&#39;s relatively inefficient. It might be possible to arrange for even stateful callbacks to outlive the analysis and thus use a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a> which would be lighter weight. This may also be less error prone as the callback is likely to reference the external <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetmachine">TargetMachine</a>, and that reference needs to never dangle.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h/#l03240">3240</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/targettransforminfo-h">TargetTransformInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
